{"blocks":[{"key":"fousi","text":"In a 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube, mix in the following order:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"415vf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fav8u","text":"Between each addition, pipette mix 10-20 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c554h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmhi2","text":"Reagent                                                     9.4.1 Flongle Volume            R10.4.1 Volume","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":106}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqh5h","text":"DNA sample from the previous step    30 μl                                           60 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b94nm","text":"Ligation Buffer (LNB)                              12.5 μl                                        25 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qcfh","text":"NEBNext Quick T4 DNA Ligase             5 μl                                             10 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5i2j1","text":"Adapter Mix H (AMX H)                          2.5 μl                                          5 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lqj2","text":"Total                                                           50 μl                                           100 μ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eut6j","text":"  Spin down with a mini centrifuge for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ct7o7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":5,"guid":"8E55E57005EF11EDADDE7FEDBB9E55F8","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":5,"guid":"8A30F3E005EF11EDADDE7FEDBB9E55F8","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

Keep the tube on the magnet, and pipette off the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8i9d2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":5,"guid":"50033010E73211EC9F27E3147D27B728","id":"80823","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"4529EF80E73211EC9F27E3147D27B728","id":"80824","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fu565","text":"Wash the beads by adding 100-250 μl Short Fragment Buffer (SFB). Flick the beads to resuspend, spin down for  , then return the tube to the magnetic rack for   and allow the beads to pellet. Remove the supernatant using a pipette and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":109,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":158,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fg11l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r70r","text":"Note: flicking the tube does not seem to fully resuspend the beads. Just flick 10 times or so.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejh73","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4s5h7","text":"SFB -   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"26ibe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":5,"guid":"C03591C0E73211EC9F27E3147D27B728","id":"80825","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"CCC8B750E73211EC9F27E3147D27B728","id":"80826","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":955770,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Ligation Sequencing Kit (Q20 )","linfor":"","url":"https://store.nanoporetech.com/us/ligation-sequencing-kit-112.html","sku":"SQK-LSK112","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"F0CE5D80E73211EC9F27E3147D27B728","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":859,"name":"Oxford Nanopore Technologies","link":"https://nanoporetech.com/","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c4gic","text":"Spin down for   and place the tube back on the magnet. Pipette off any residual supernatant. Allow to dry for ~30 seconds, but do not dry the pellet to the point of cracking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"97o2q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":5,"guid":"B5D44050E73211EC9F27E3147D27B728","id":"80827","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6nb8r","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend the pellet in 15 μl Elution Buffer (EB). Spin down for   and incubate for   at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":108,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":127,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9nbmj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":5,"guid":"D8EFD4A0E73211EC9F27E3147D27B728","id":"80828","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"DB4B50D0E73211EC9F27E3147D27B728","id":"80829","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acg33","text":"Pellet the beads on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colorless, for at least 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c9bgs","text":"Remove and retain 15 μl of eluate containing the DNA library into a clean 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"i3qv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fvdnj","text":"Store on ice until you are ready to load in your flowcell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0dp5","text":"If you have access to a Quantus or Qubit fluorimeter, now is a good time to quantify 1uL of DNA in your sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kn2p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jssa","text":"It is recommend loading 5 fmol to 10 fmol of this final prepared library onto your flow cells. Loading more than 20 fmol of DNA can reduce the rate of duplex read capture. Dilute the library in Elution Buffer if required.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3ooo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9t8p","text":"https://www.promega.com/resources/tools/biomath/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6733b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eacsr","text":"For 900bp length DNA (what our ITS1F-4 rxns appear to average), we are looking for ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mv13","text":"Flongle R9.4.1: 5 fmol - 20 fmol = .003ug - .012ug of DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8k8j","text":"MinION R9.4.1: 5 - 50 fmol = .003ug - .029ug of DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9eq2s","text":"MinION R10.4.1: 25 - 75 fmol = .015ug - .044ug of DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfo6p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3l3gc","text":"For a 22 ng/uL sample (Quantus quantification):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1oh0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"af8il","text":"22ng         1ug","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ai26","text":"--------   *   --------       =   0.022ug/uL    *   15uL (elution buffer; or 13 if you quantified using 2uL)  =  0.33 ug DNA in sample of 15uL elution buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f2gi","text":" 1uL         1000ng","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85kea","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6lc4","text":"*Note: the 0.33 in the calculations below will change based on your individual DNA amount.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6blv5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39hej","text":"**Also note: The ONT protocol suggests using additional EB in order to make concentration adjustments. As there is not a lot of the reagent in the standard packets, and it is not possible to buy more individually, I have been using molecular water for this step with no ill effect. You could always calculate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fo6c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bd1u1","text":"Flongle 9.4.1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhote","text":"How much additional molecular water to have 5.5uL needed for the next step give us correct amount of DNA? ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9k71s","text":"0.33ug / xuL = 0.010ug (17 fmol DNA)   x = 33uL   x 5.5uL  =  181.5uL - 15uL = 166.5uL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1r2cp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqsis","text":"So at 0.022ug/uL quantification, add an additional 166.5uL of molecular water to have right concentration to use 5.5uL for the next step with Flongle. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1hdf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96nms","text":"11ng/uL sample comes out to adding an additional 78.5 uL of molecular water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3k2q4","text":"31ng/uL sample comes out to adding an additional 221.65 uL of molecular water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2un3i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bflse","text":"I would use 150 uL if you are not able to quantify your sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sbaq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"plkj","text":"MinION R9.4.1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42di6","text":"0.33ug / xuL = 0.025ug (42 fmol DNA)   x = 13.2uL   x 11uL =  145.2uL - 15uL = 130uL elution buffer addition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2139t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c44m6","text":"MinION R10.4.1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5aq85","text":"0.33ug / xuL = 0.04ug (67 fmol DNA)   x = 8.25uL   x 11uL =  90.75uL - 15uL = 75uL elution buffer addition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
